intro: Heteropterys lasseri, commonly known as the Lasser's huito, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the Andean regions of South America, particularly in countries like Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
